reviewText:
Let me start by saying that I've played Allods since day one open beta, for around 4 years (over 12k hours of actual play time). I've stopped playing the game for nearly 2 years now, but I do still lurk the forum and occasionaly log in the game to check what's new, In case the game had a 180º turn, as well to keep in touch with some good old friends (the very few that haven't quit by now).

I was for the most part an hardcore player, purely free to play, part of some of the best endgame guilds (Invalid, 3rdFaction, WarSong, MInc).

With that being said, my review is from a vet endgamer point of view, that went through multiple updates, server merges and even publisher changes (gpotato/webzen, Mycom).

Allods as a game, is a great mmo, it has plenty of content to keep your enternained, leveling was never so easy (those who were around during gipat update as well the lv47 24k gold cap, can relate). There's a very good amount of zones with different aspects to it, and the endgame can be fun if you play for fun and not to solely outperform the guy next to you in hope that your epeen will stretch a tiny bit more.

However the Allods curse is the free-to-play" model it has. It's the worst piece of crap you can possibly find in a game. The company is utterly greedy and will make sure the cow is milked to its bones.
So unless you have very deep pockets or are willing to spend ridiculous amounts of time farming in circles
recommended: this game is not for you and you should avoid it at all cost.\n\nThe fact there is a currency exchanger where you can trade ingame currency (Gold) for Item Shop currency (Crystals) becomes meaningless when you take a look at the racio. All the best and must have items comes exclusively from gambling. Radiant Strongbox sales EVERY SINGLE WEEK
hoursPlayed: just to make sure you don't stack too much gold
voteText: and spend money to stay afloat. You can technically buy it from other players with gold
helpfulPercent: but the prices are off limits to most people.\n\nAnd when I say "must have"
votesHelpful: you realy must have those items or you won't stand a chance in PvP and PvE. I'm talking about scrolls that give extra talent points
commentsCount: unlimited build reset and stats reset
column18: there's different qualities on most those items (green
column23: giving those that have all these Pay-To-Win items
column25: new comers and occasional buyers.\n\nAnd don't even make me talk about runes. Basically
column29: it goes from lv1 to 13. To make a lv2 runes you need two lv1
column30: to make a lv3 you need two lv2
column31: and so on... Bare minimum to stay competitive shoud be full lv9 by now.\n\nThen there's patronage that increase your damage a lot and costs too much as well. It's just too many things you need to spend your money or huge amount of time on
column33: they keep adding more with each new update.\n\nThe community in the game keeps getting smaller and smaller
column34: after a month you'll already know who is who. I won't say it's a toxic community
column35: but I have to say it's demanding and there's barely any room for mistakes.\n\nThe truth is
column36: Allods always had a lot of potencial
column39: it never went past the hopes and dreams we
column41: had.\n\nIf you're still brave enought to waste your time in this mess
column42: you better make a bank loan and keep in mind you're going up against many players that literally spent so much money by now
column43: that they could have bought a new car or two."

reviewText:
Horrible download speeds fluctuating back and forth from 500kbs to 6.0 mbs. I spent 105 minutes in the games patcher just downloading a 9.02gb file, the launcher also throttle's your bandwith causing eveything else to load slow. You dev's need to update your steam file, this ♥♥♥♥♥ rediculous no one is going to download the game.

You want an actual game review?

I played Allod's when it was under gPotato for a litte over a year long before the game came to steam.

New Frontier is the F2P server, you need high level runes to survive in PvP. Runes will play a major roll the only way to level up runes in the game is to buy Crystal Chips from the Cash Shop or the Auction House the current price for 1 CC is 360g.

Level 13 runes give you +130% damage and healing or -56.52% incoming damage you need about 79,000 CC to make 1 level 13, 1000 CC is $11 or 360,000 gold.

The server is open pvp from level 21+. There is also an additional form of pvp that opens at level 35 Astral Ship Combat where you get a crappy starter ship, you have to invest a ton of gold, time and parts to upgrade the ship and if you want a special skin you need to spend $$. The astral system is FFA so your ship can get boarded. your faction can kill you all while you're battling the opposite faction and to top it off you can get your loot stolen in the process.

Mounts in this game are also unlocked with real money unless you get lucky enough to get one in an event otherwise you have to farm Gold for Blue Crystals but it's at a 1000G to 1BC ratio sure any thing can be gotten off the auction house so long as you're rich enough to buy it.

Now you can avoid all of this if you just want you just have to spend $11 to play on Smuggler's Paradise which offers less of the P2W and more things like you would find in the more popullar game called World of Warcraft which this is pretty much a low budget copy.

I don't recommend you play this unless you have no other game to play or you have a small inheritance to spend. The game's on it's last leg, Smuggler's Paradise is a barren wasteland and New Frontier doesn't have enough Empire players to stand up to the Legue.

reviewText:
Well... This game is basically a modified Russian-themed World of Warcraft with auto-run features.... Everything will feel familiar if you are a World of Warcraft player. You will find many similarities like Humans(Kanians + Xadaganians), Elves (Also known as Elves), Orcs (Just Orcs), Undead (Arisen), Werewolves(Priden) and the Gnome replacement (Gibberlings who are Tiny Furries). However, the problem is just that. What's so special about this game? What does it have that World of Warcraft doesn't? Also, it's Pay To Win, it's 100 Euros for 10,700 Crystals (cash currency). With Crystals, you can buy Mounts, Buffs and even remove Curses on powerful weapons. If you don't have Crystal, it sucks to play this game.

PROS
1. Auto-quest
My favourite part of the game. Don't know where to go? Press auto-quest, it will bring you to wherever you need to be. The only thing that World of Warcraft doesn't have.

2. The Beginning (Arisen)
2 Guild Ships duking it out while a giant Astral watches. So cool.

3. Gibberlings
You control them as a group of 3. Very unique.

4. The Beginning (Gibberlings)
June Ruins with the floating bubble. The flying ships which resembled the transport boat system in World of Warcraft's Booty Bay.

5. Crafting Mini-Luck Game
There's a tiny mini-game if you try to craft items. It's purely luck based.

6. Quest Markers
They have little markers on the mini-map that highlight other quests in the area. If you scroll over them, it tells you what you need to collect or do. This is very useful.

7. Less Aggro Range
Majority of creatures are Neutral (Yellow Circle). This makes it less annoying to run around and is more thematic.

CONS
1. Bad Story
It's not a gripping story, it's just not the way the Warcraft lore unfolded.

2. Level Limiters
If you're 3 Levels below a boss monster's, you're dead. There is no way to deal it any damage. Gain 1 more Level and suddenly he's feeling the pinch.

3. Fetch Quest
Haven't most MMORPGs understood this by now? You shouldn't need to make a return journey to turn in the quest. Just comms it in. There are no generic speed-up spells so you'll have to play a tedious game. If you forget to collect a quest from a NPC, get ready to run back and forth.

4. Pay To Win
You can actually pay money to get stronger in this game. Horrible business model. 100 Euros for 10,700 Crystals (cash currency).

5. The Game Engine Technology
For a $12 million" game
date: this game has really old technology. It's like time stood still and locked it in the World of Warcraft engine
recommended:
which FYI is over 10 years old.

6. Lamp Post Issue
All NPCs and creeps just stand and patrol the same area. There is nothing special about them. They don't "live or breathe".

7. No Flying or Swimming or Fishing
All the little things are missing.

8. Grinding
The max level in this game is 70 but it takes a long time just to grind past level 10.

9. Professions
Similar to World of Warcraft
hoursPlayed: 1 profession at any time. You can get a max of 2 if you get a certificate. Tailoring
voteText: Leatherworking
commentsCount:
etc

10. Classes
It's really similar to World of Warcraft. There are 10 main types with differnt names for different races but they are all the same.

11. AI is pretty silly
You attack a Mutineer ship to get 3 treasures. They are all aggressive. Don't worry
column16:
you just need to attack 3 or 4 Mutineers and the rest won't take heed of who you are.

12. Talent Point System
You gain Talent Points to put into your Talent Tree at a really slow rate of 1 Talent Point per level. However
column17: you need a cumulative amount of points for each additional skill level. E.g. Level 1 Bee Swarm needs 1 TP to upgrade
column19: Level 3 needs 3 TP and so on and so forth."

reviewText:
Okay:

It's fun. It's very, very fun. The mechanics are interesting, the gameplay is alright and the portrayal is superb.

Fair warning though: from what i can tell, this is NOT for you if you are a PvP fan. The PvE content is great and will keep you going but it seems the F2P server is plagued by cash-shop issues.

Will report back after I get up into the top tiers, but i feel that it may be impossible to PvP as a newcomer without playing on the subscription only server.

That said, the game isn't going anywhere soon its had a steady flow of updates since its launch a long time ago, and recently its newest expansion pack. So, give it a shot.

reviewText:
Hear me out.
The game is A LOT of fun. The aesthetics and designs are really nice, and the classes all are unique and fun to play.
HOWEVER, I cannot recommend this game if you're planning to play on the F2P server. Sure, make a character there and test it out, but don't invest there.
I can only recommend this game if you subscribe and play on the subscription server. No cash shop, and no pay2win.
It sounds very stupid saying don't pay2win
recommended: but that's how it's set up. The f2p server is pretty much a trial
hoursPlayed: and you'll end up spending hundreds
voteText: maybe thousands of euros in order to stay competitive for PVE&PVP
helpfulPercent: while on the subscription server it's 10euros a month
votesTotal: I can only recommend this game if you enjoyed trying the F2P server and don't mind subscribing and playing on that server instead."

reviewText:
Some of the negative reviews i saw regarding this game...

'The game is dead' - Then why don't you do something against that? Are the devs supposed to flood areas with AI controlled players, or don't you have any friends to accompany you?

'UGH, fluctuating download speed in the launcher' - Go to the launcher and disable P2P, or stop downloading your porns. In what way does this justify a negative review about a game itself anyways?

'WoW is better than this game' - Then why did you stop playing it in the first place?

'It is P2W and i'm not willing to pay a single cent, as i would support the devs that way and help keeping up the servers and the support.' - Not even worth a comment. Servers, maintenance and employees do not pay themselves, and i'm sure the thousands of worthless steam indie games in your library did not, either.


I for one, think that Allods is a great MMO and it does not have any flaws that inevitably prevent you from having fun in it, or that can not be bypassed by any means. It all depends on your willingness to accept flaws. Or aswell just reject them ... be doomed forever looking for the non-existentperfect F2P MMO that you always wanted.
voteText: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
A pretty standard, run of the mill fantasy MMORPG - but the Space Opera setting is cool and it looks really good IMO.

The P2P server is not P2W at all - but the F2P server is, if you intend to do high-level PvP.

PvE is great - I'm not sure how easily you can find groups for lower level dungeons though.

I recommend giving it a try if you're a fan of WoW, LotRO, Wildstar etc. - it's pretty fun.

(Also the game is very generous to F2P players in the way of leveling gifts with equipment and Exp scrolls, things like that. which is nice.)

I'm really enjoying it.
